abstract: New York City's Rent Guidelines Board, days after state agreed to extend rent regulations for four more years, is set to vote on whether to increase rents for more than one million rent-stabilized apartments; board has never voted for no increases.
lead_paragraph: New York City’s Rent Guidelines Board will vote on Monday on whether to increase rents for more than one million stabilized apartments. It has never voted for no increases.

headline.main: New York City Board Set to Vote on Rent Freeze After State Legislators Reach Deal
headline.print_headline: City Board Set to Vote on Rent Freeze After State Legislators Reach Deal

snippet: New York City’s Rent Guidelines Board will vote on Monday on whether to increase rents for more than one million stabilized apartments. It has never voted for no increases.
